description: Composite numbers that are the sum of a string of consecutive prime numbers and are divisible by the first and last primes.
comments: Composite n such that n = p_1 + p_2 + ... + p_k where the p_i are consecutive primes and n is divisible by p_1 and p_k.No more terms below 10^22. - _Michael Beight_, Jul 22 2012
references: Problem proposed by Carlos Rivera, who found first 4 terms.
author: _Jud McCranie_, Jul 03 2000
extensions: 7228559051256366318 = 73+79+83+ ... +18281691653 is also in the sequence but may not be the next term.
a(8) and a(9) from _Michael Beight_, Jul 22 2012
